The Buddha was staying in the city of Shravasti. At that time, King Jayadharma and Queen Mallika had just given birth to a daughter with eighteen extremely ugly features.
As she gradually grew up, she was to be married, but the noble families did not like to marry her, and the king did not approve of the lower classes.
At that time, there was the son of an elder from a foreign country who had been staying in the city for a long time, and his expenses were all exhausted. He wandered around without any match.

The king then summoned him and said:
I have an elder daughter, whom I will give to you as a wife.
If you follow me, you will enjoy wealth and nobility forever.
If you wish to return to your country, you may go together with me.
At that time, the king's daughter immediately adorned her body with various precious treasures and gave herself to him as a wife, along with countless kinds of wealth.
The elder's son then took her as his wife, and before long they returned to his home country together.
After arriving home, his relatives sought to see her and make offerings.
The elder's son said:

If you must see her, you must choose a date.
Later, the relatives again came to his house, and the elder's son said:

The group then said:

On the seventh day, the son of the elder prepared various delicious foods, first taking a portion and placing it in his room, informing his wife and firmly locking the door.

At that time, the deity guarding the house, having seen this, thought:
